justification: The article explains that “SentiWordNet associates with each ‘synset’ three continuous numeric scores: positivity, negativity and neutrality… By aggregating these scores across the entire text, an overall sentiment value can be derived,” indicating that the construct of text sentiment is operationalised with the SentiWordNet scoring tool.

topic_or_construct: discrete emotions in text (e.g., joy, sadness, anger, fear, surprise, disgust)
measured_by: Mohammad & Turney word-emotion association tool / NRC Emotion Lexicon
justification: It states that “Mohammad and Turney developed a tool that can identify and measure a spectrum of emotions, such as joy, sadness, anger, fear, surprise, and disgust,” showing that this instrument is used to quantify specific emotional constructs in text.

topic_or_construct: moral foundation values in text (care, fairness, loyalty, authority, sanctity, liberty)
measured_by: computational models implementing Moral Foundations Theory
justification: The authors note that “Computational models have been developed to identify these moral values in textual data, effectively giving a ‘normative score’ based on these foundations,” directly linking the moral-foundations construct to its measurement approach.

measured_by: computational models based on Morality-as-Cooperation theory
justification: They add that “The same happens for the more recent morality-as-cooperation theory,” indicating that analogous computational tools are used to measure cooperative moral constructs.

measured_by: GPT-4 sentiment ratings on a 1–7 scale derived from bespoke prompts
justification: The method section describes that each instruction was input into GPT-4 with the prompt asking, “How negative or positive is the action… on a 1–7 scale,” and that the resulting numbers (S_zero, S_half, S_all) were used, evidencing that GPT-4 ratings served as the measurement instrument for this sentiment construct.
